lead_paragraph: ATNALLY--Richard, of Broomfield, CO, passed away on June 14th from complications following a fall. Dick, as he was known, is survived by his beloved wife Mary, daughter Diane Conlin of Superior, CO, son David of Cambridge, VT, grandchildren Kevin and Julia, and brother Edward of Bronxville, NY. He was predeceased by his parents Olive and Edward, and his twin brother, William. He was a Professor of English Literature at William Paterson University in Wayne, NJ for 24 years where he founded and directed the Humanities Honors Program, a program designed to challenge students with ideas and concepts beyond their normal experiences. Dick enjoyed sharing with his students his love of poetry, literature, and the history of ideas. He involved them in making films about significant poets of Greenwich Village and Paterson, NJ, including William Carlos Williams and Alan Ginsburg. Dick also taught at Queens University in Charlotte, NC, New York's School for Social Research, and Yale University. He and Mary were married for 56 wonderful years, during which time they shared their passion for traveling, art, and history. Services will be private. Contributions in Dick's memory may be sent to the WB Yeats Society of New York, c/o National Arts Club, 15 Gramercy Park South, NYC 10003. 1/3
